Topic.Title: Sales tax will run thousands of mom and pops off ebay

Message.Msg: Once again, when a merchant ships an item across state lines, it is the buyer's responsibility to pay the "use tax" ~ There is no evading anything. Merchants have no obligation except for collecting tax on in-state sales. Additionally, I live in a state that has no sales tax and you should see all the people from from surrounding states flocking to do some tax free shopping.

Topic.Title: What other stock CRASHs 12% on good earnings & growth forecast?

Message.Msg: Forecast is not actual earnings which missed their mark for Q1. That in itself takes away credibility from John Donahoe's forecast growth. Now we're headed into the two slowest quarters for retail. Guaranteed after the new fees kick in May 1st, numerous merchants will be jumping ship. As much as 300% increase for sellers of expensive items. Of course, Amazon and other niche marketplaces will benefit from the fee increase.

Topic.Title: Sales Tax Can and SHOULD be collected by Ebay on all Sales....

Message.Msg: Be careful what you wish for because if eBay collects the sales tax, you just know they're going to find a way to collect fees on that also.

Topic.Title: eBay & sales tax

Message.Msg: Sales tax gets charged to the buyer, just like in a retail store. Oh, and btw, in case you can read, according to the bill "Online retailers with out-of-state sales of less than $1 million a year would be exempt. " What's the big deal?

Topic.Title: My ebay fees more than doubled. I don't care about the sales tax.

Message.Msg: Online retailers with out-of-state sales of less than $1 million a year would be exempt according to the bill. Not exactly going to hurt eBay mom&pop sellers, only eBay mega diamond sellers, especially the Chinese ones like eForCity who has a physical business location in the United States are going to have to add sales tax to their penny profit items. Diamond sellers like Jack Sheng are the one's Ding #$%$ Donahoe wants to protect..Not you or me but he's using this as a rallying cry without giving the full information. Slimy as ever.

Message.Title: PayPal is Going Live at 2 Million Retail Locations Now $$$$
Message.Msg: PayPal to Go Live at 2 Million Retail Locations By Steve Heller | More Articles | Save For Later April 23, 2013 It's official! eBay's (NASDAQ: EBAY ) PayPal has begun going live at over 2 million U.S. retail locations where Discover Cards are accepted. This is a pinnacle moment for the online payment processor that's trying to capture share in the tremendous point-of-sale market. Despite eBay's ambitions, there are many challenges for the company to overcome before investors can call this move a success. In this video, Motley Fool contributor Steve Heller examines how big of an opportunity this could be for PayPal and what factors will contribute to its success.

Topic.Title: Sales tax will run thousands of mom and pops off ebay

Message.Msg: It appears that Mom and Pop stores would not be affected; in fact they'd be helped if I'm reading this right. The article says that sales tax would only have to be collected outside of your selling state; by businesses that make $1 million or more in sales. This sales tax legislation will actually help small sellers and mom and pop stores. They will not have to charge buyers extra for sales tax, while the large mega stores will have to charge and collect sales tax on every single purchase. John Donahue hates small sellers so of course he's fighting for the huge mega stores while quietly telling no one that his actually helps small sellers

Topic.Title: Sales tax will run thousands of mom and pops off ebay

Message.Msg: Not me. Ebay works very well for me. It pays all my bills. EPAMB

Topic.Title: Sales tax will run thousands of mom and pops off ebay

Message.Msg: Right on, Donahoe has forgotten to mention, in his call to arms from eBay sellers, that only those doing over $1 million in out-of-state sales will be required to collect sales tax. Bad news for his buddy Jack Sheng and eForCity, good news for small merchants and mom&pop sellers.

Topic.Title: Sales tax will run thousands of mom and pops off ebay

Message.Msg: Despite the drop in stock and the sales tax news, this was my best few weeks of sales on eBay in almost two years. The free auctions last week were a huge success and last weekend was amazing. Like eBay circa 2009 and before. Doubt it will continue like this but it was a anicce surprise.
